required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Electric Impedance Tomography Before and After Dilatative Tracheotomy
clinical_study.official_title: EIT: Changes of Pulmonary Ventilation Before and After Tracheotomy

brief_summary.textblock: The changes of local pulmonary ventilation should be registered with an electric impedance tomography (EIT) before and after a dilatative tracheotomy. The hypothesis is that the EIT cannot show changes in local ventilation due to the tracheotomy.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline (2 Minutes preoperative) until 2 Minutes postoperative
primary_outcome.description: measurement starts twenty minutes before surgery and ends after realised recruitment after tracheotomy.

arm_group.arm_group_label: ICU patients undergoing a dilatative tracheotomy.

intervention.arm_group_label: ICU patients undergoing a dilatative tracheotomy.

study_pop.textblock: ICU patients undergoing an elective dilatative tracheotomy. Before and after tracheotomy the results of EIT will be compared.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- treatment on ICU
- indication for tracheotomy
- age between 18 and 85 years
- written to consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- severe chronic pulmonary disease
- cardio pulmonary unstable situation

results_reference.citation: Eichler L, Mueller J, Grensemann J, Frerichs I, Zöllner C, Kluge S. Lung aeration and ventilation after percutaneous tracheotomy measured by electrical impedance tomography in non-hypoxemic critically ill patients: a prospective observational study. Ann Intensive Care. 2018 Nov 15;8(1):110. doi: 10.1186/s13613-018-0454-y.
